This result indicates that within the time-scale of MD simulations, the oxygen octahedron around Al is stable, which can also be seen from the PCN versus temperature curve, as presented in Figure 4. At temperatures above 1100 K, N AlO starts to drop, which means that after the breakdown of the octahedral Li coordination above 450 K, the framework made up of the AlO 6 octahedra remains stable until 1100 K. Above 1300 K, the octahedral coordination around Al becomes unstable.
